snippet.textDisplay: I know favorite games often have a lot to do with when you played them and your mindset and what was going on at the time.  But OoT came out my senior year of highschool and was one of my last solid solo gaming experiences for a while (i played MGS a year later after it was out that too), after that I had college roomates and was gaming, but a lot more multiplayer and with other people around.  This song, the level, the game, its not my favorite zelda, but possibly my single favorite dungeon in any zelda game.
snippet.textOriginal: I know favorite games often have a lot to do with when you played them and your mindset and what was going on at the time.  But OoT came out my senior year of highschool and was one of my last solid solo gaming experiences for a while (i played MGS a year later after it was out that too), after that I had college roomates and was gaming, but a lot more multiplayer and with other people around.  This song, the level, the game, its not my favorite zelda, but possibly my single favorite dungeon in any zelda game.

snippet.textDisplay: @Chrisevil  Totally agree. The Forest Temple is definitely an unsettling place, and the theme doesn't help. I always thought of the Shadow Temple as more upbeat because I was expecting it to be dark and eerie. I didn't expect the Forest Temple to be the way it was, so little me was a lot more frightened by this theme.
snippet.textOriginal: @Chrisevil  Totally agree. The Forest Temple is definitely an unsettling place, and the theme doesn't help. I always thought of the Shadow Temple as more upbeat because I was expecting it to be dark and eerie. I didn't expect the Forest Temple to be the way it was, so little me was a lot more frightened by this theme.

snippet.textDisplay: Fear is different to everyone.  We all have our kinds of fears.  To me, the Forest Temple theme was more eerie than creepy.  The darkish, foggy atmosphere of the Temple gave a scary, haunted feel to it.  However, the Shadows Temple's atmosphere & music is really what scared the crap out of me as a kid D:
snippet.textOriginal: Fear is different to everyone.  We all have our kinds of fears.  To me, the Forest Temple theme was more eerie than creepy.  The darkish, foggy atmosphere of the Temple gave a scary, haunted feel to it.  However, the Shadows Temple's atmosphere & music is really what scared the crap out of me as a kid D:

snippet.textDisplay: JordanMeAwesome I've thought a little bit about how some classic entertainment will age. OOT is not That old, relatively speaking. But in terms of video games, it's getting "old". Electronics and electronic entertainment ages fast I guess. Just the way it is. In 500 years, I should hope that this game will still be remembered. It'll still be fun to play I'll bet. Good games never die. Same with music, movies, TV, etc. But subjective nonetheless. I'm still betting it'll hold it's own no matter how much time may pass.

snippet.textDisplay: I think a lot of the fear associated with this song has to do with the fact that a lot of people played this game when they were kids, so if the first thing you hear when walking into an abandoned, overgrown temple is this creepfest, it can be pretty unsettling. Then, you're immediately attacked by Wolfos and you've got some good nightmare fuel for a week or so.

snippet.textDisplay: The moment I stepped into the front entrance of the Forest Temple and this music started playing, I knew that the game was telling me that happy play time was over and now was the time to get serious. There's something serene and mysterious, yet there's a hint of the sinister here that had me thoroughly creeped out the entire dungeon. Not to mention the first encounter with those wall/floor masters... No other Zelda monster has ever scared me more than those have.
snippet.textOriginal: The moment I stepped into the front entrance of the Forest Temple and this music started playing, I knew that the game was telling me that happy play time was over and now was the time to get serious. There's something serene and mysterious, yet there's a hint of the sinister here that had me thoroughly creeped out the entire dungeon. Not to mention the first encounter with those wall/floor masters... No other Zelda monster has ever scared me more than those have.

snippet.textDisplay:
I remember when I was a kid, it wasn't the music that scared me, it was those goddamn Wolfos at the beginning. D:

But yeah, me, I think this is easily the best music in OoT ever. Fire Temple music is also kinda good, but that's probably not on your list because it sounds blank in the later versions of OoT. In the earlier versions, it had some kind of chanting in the background. It was taken out because it resembled Muslim chanting.
snippet.textOriginal:
I remember when I was a kid, it wasn't the music that scared me, it was those goddamn Wolfos at the beginning. D:

But yeah, me, I think this is easily the best music in OoT ever. Fire Temple music is also kinda good, but that's probably not on your list because it sounds blank in the later versions of OoT. In the earlier versions, it had some kind of chanting in the background. It was taken out because it resembled Muslim chanting.

snippet.textDisplay: One of my favorite song in the entire game, and one of my favorite songs in the entire series. It's so eerie, and I really recall a long time ago going in Spirit Ganon's chamber and seeing the blue glow of Link's eyes. It literally made my blood sank for a moment, I was scared.

snippet.textDisplay: that fucking key ur refering to is the key in the middle pillar of the entire temple where u play the song to raise/lower the water. when u raise the water drop all the way down and the floor mat will lift up revealing the small chest for that key u need to enter miniboss room (shadow link). snippet.textDisplay: To be honest, I'm not at all surprised to see some people dislike this song. It is pretty special, I can't deny that. Have you played the game? You definitely hear it in a different way. When I hear this song, I instantly imagine being deep inside the eerie and ethereal Forest Temple, alone, with puzzles to solve. Without that image, it wouldn't be the same.
